attributes.action: Introduce Compulsory books on Systemic Racism in the Education System.
attributes.additional_details:
What I experience on a daily occurrence is different from what was taught in the history books. Whilst book glorified the World War 1, Great Fire of London, a lot of important history was missed out!

This has now led to individuals being misinformed and ignorant as a result of not understanding important factors such as White Privilege and Systemic Racism.  Therefore, we as a society must take it upon us to educate individuals in order for them to be well informed and tackle these issues.
attributes.background:
I want the government to introduce: 
• Mandatory training for teachers on labelling and prejudice in the Education System. 
•Compulsory books on white privilege, systemic racism and British Colonial History in the Education System.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Mandate regular anti-racist training for all teachers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326047

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934

Amend the Equality Act 2010: National curriculum and protected characteristics: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327300

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
